name: A.P. (DIR Series) Circular No. 19
summary: This circular expands the investment basket for Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPI) in corporate debt securities. It allows FPIs to invest in unlisted corporate debt securities and securitised debt instruments within a limit of ₹35,000 crore. The unlisted corporate debt must have a minimum residual maturity of three years with restrictions on real estate business, capital market, and land purchase investments. Securitised debt instruments are exempt from the 3-year maturity requirement. These investments fall within the overall corporate bond limit of ₹2,44,323 crore.
questions: What is the investment limit for FPIs in unlisted corporate debt securities and securitised debt instruments?
What is the minimum residual maturity requirement for unlisted corporate debt securities?
Are securitised debt instruments subject to the minimum 3-year residual maturity requirement?
What is the current overall investment limit prescribed for corporate bonds?
When will the revised norms be reviewed?
